intro: Psychotria capituliflora, commonly known as the red-veined psychotria, is a tropical flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its striking, waxy leaves with deep red veins and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species, many of which are known for their ornamental value. Psychotria capituliflora thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Its unique foliage makes it a popular choice for indoor gardening and botanical collections.
